UI_visible_response: Chinese society places significant emphasis on upholding and protecting core values, particularly those tied to traditional culture and socialism. For instance, the older generation and rural Chinese tend to value traditional culture and strive to preserve it, which reflects a commitment to maintaining certain societal norms and values2. Additionally, core socialist values—such as prosperity, democracy, civility, harmony, freedom, and equality—are regarded as central to contemporary Chinese society. These values are seen as a crystallization of shared ideals among the Chinese people and represent the "contemporary Chinese spirit"5.Moreover, these values are not just theoretical; they are actively promoted through policies and education. Efforts to secure a "decisive victory in building a moderately prosperous society" emphasize the integration of these values into daily life, indicating an institutional effort to uphold and protect them6. Thus, both traditional and modern socialist values are actively upheld and safeguarded within Chinese society through cultural preservation and state-led initiatives.
traffic_visible_response: Chinese society places significant emphasis on upholding and protecting core values, particularly those tied to traditional culture and socialism. For instance, the older generation and rural Chinese tend to value traditional culture and strive to preserve it, which reflects a commitment to maintaining certain societal norms and values [[2]]. Additionally, core socialist values—such as prosperity, democracy, civility, harmony, freedom, and equality—are regarded as central to contemporary Chinese society. These values are seen as a crystallization of shared ideals among the Chinese people and represent the "contemporary Chinese spirit" [[5]]. Moreover, these values are not just theoretical; they are actively promoted through policies and education. Efforts to secure a "decisive victory in building a moderately prosperous society" emphasize the integration of these values into daily life, indicating an institutional effort to uphold and protect them [[6]]. Thus, both traditional and modern socialist values are actively upheld and safeguarded within Chinese society through cultural preservation and state-led initiatives.
